result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald E. Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $500 & $1411.36  plus surcharges.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Dated May 28, 2019 - IT IS ORDERED that the judgment and order are summarily affirmed.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Leon W. Todd is relieved from further representing Ronald E. Wright in this appeal.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Leon Todd.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Victims present in court.  Arguments heard.  The court denies the motion for post conviction relief.  The court also notes that Bangert relief does not apply.  If the supreme court decides in the two pending cases that a DNA surcharge is punitive or that it needs to be covered in colloquy, the issue can be re-addressed.  Attorney Todd to prepare order.

Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney David Celebre.  The court sentences the defendant as follows:

Total Sentence                                                          13  years  0 months
Total Incarceration                                                      8  years  0 months
Total extended supervision w/conditions                 5  years  0 months
Consecutive to 11CF729
The defendants is not eligible for programs.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  The defendant refused to sign the voter ineligibility and acknowledgment & firearms warning paperwork. Clerk D. Smith.
Sentencing hearing on November 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
P&P advised that they never rec'd the request for a PSI.  Therefore, the sentencing is being rescheduled from 11/2/16 @ 3:00 to 11/28/16 @ 3:00.  Criminal clerk advised to notify P&P.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney David Celebre.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  On state's motion counts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read in.  Defendant pleads guilty to count 1; court finds the defendant guilty.  The defendant does not dispute any restitution amount.  PSI ordered.  Per Judge, sentencing set for 11/2/16 @ 3:00.  Bond continued.
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty David Celebre.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  At the request of Atty Celebre, hearing adj. to 9/15/16 at 2:30.  Bond continued.

Atty Celebre was recently appointed and requests an adjournment; no objection by the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.
